page.title: 12A DAY IN HARVEST
page.content: My husband rises at 6.00am he brings me a cup of tea in bed at 7.00am. I get-up at 7.30am bath, make the beds and tidy the upstairs of the house. I have my breakfast alone, my husband and son having had theirs earlier before the men arrive at 7.30am. There is usually several telephone messages to take during breakfast. During harvest my son aged 23, drives one of the combines so his meals have to be packed for the day he has 'nineses', a snack consisting of a sandwich and a flask of tea, then lunch and tea. My husband comes home for lunch, usually a cold meal. This morning I went to Bury St. Edmunds shopping being Market Day is very busy. Found a parking space, bought bacon, coffee and sausages at the Grocer's, back to car, then to the market to buy fruit, tomatoes, cucumber and fish and finished shopping at the Supermarket.
